009package imagingbook.common.hough;
010
011import java.util.ArrayList;
012import java.util.Collections;
013import java.util.List;
014
015import ij.process.ByteProcessor;
016import ij.process.FloatProcessor;
017import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
018import imagingbook.common.util.ParameterBundle;
019import imagingbook.common.util.progress.ProgressReporter;
020
021/**
022 * This class implements the "classic" Hough Transform for straight lines.
023 * This implementation improves the algorithm described in the textbook in
024 * the way the accumulator is updated. Here, the quantity 1 is not added
025 * to a single accumulator cell but gets distributed over two neighboring
026 * (radial) cells to reduce aliasing effects. Thus we accumulate non-integer
027 * values and therefore the various accumulators are of type {@code float[][]}.
028 * 
029 * @author W. Burger
030 * @version 2022/04/01
031 * @version 2022/09/10  removed ImageJ progress reporting
032 */
033public class HoughTransformLines implements ProgressReporter {
034        
035        // TODO: revise constructors and parameters, add bias correction
036
037        public static class Parameters implements ParameterBundle {     
038                /** Number of angular steps over [0, pi] */
039                public int nAng = 256;          
040                /** Number of radial steps in each pos/neg direction (accum. size = 2 * nRad + 1) */
041                public int nRad = 128;
042        }
043
044        private final int nAng; // number of angular steps over [0, pi]
045        private final int nRad; // number of radial steps in each pos/neg direction
046
047        private final int width, height; // size of the reference frame (image)
048        private final double xRef, yRef; // reference point (x/y-coordinate of image center)
049
050        private final double dAng; // increment of angle
051        private final double dRad; // increment of radius
052        private final int cRad; // array index representing the zero radius
053
054        private final int accWidth; // width of the accumulator array (angular direction)
055        private final int accHeight; // height of the accumulator array (radial direction)
056        private final float[][] accumulator; // accumulator array
057        private final float[][] accumulatorExt; // extended accumulator array
058        private final float[][] accumulatorMax; // accumulator, with local maxima only
059
060        private final double[] cosTable; // tabulated cosine values
061        private final double[] sinTable; // tabulated sine values
062
063        // -------------- public constructor(s) ------------------------
064
065        /**
066         * Constructor. Creates a new Hough transform from the binary image.
067         * 
068         * @param I      input image, relevant (edge) points have pixel values greater 0.
069         * @param params parameter object.
070         */
071        public HoughTransformLines(ByteProcessor I, Parameters params) {
072                this(I.getWidth(), I.getHeight(), params);
073                this.process(I, accumulator);
074        }
075        
076        public HoughTransformLines(ByteProcessor I) {
077                this(I, new Parameters());
078        }
079
080        /**
081         * Constructor. Creates a new Hough transform from a sequence of 2D points. Parameters M, N
082         * are only used to specify the reference point (usually at the center of the
083         * image). Use this constructor if the relevant image points are collected
084         * separately.
085         * 
086         * @param points an array of 2D points.
087         * @param width      width of the corresponding image plane.
088         * @param height      height of the corresponding image plane.
089         * @param params parameter object.
090         */
091        public HoughTransformLines(Pnt2d[] points, int width, int height, Parameters params) {
092                this(width, height, params);
093                this.process(points, accumulator);
094        }
095
096        // Non-public constructor used by public constructors (to initialize all final
097        // members variables).
098        private HoughTransformLines(int width, int height, Parameters params) {
099                if (params == null) 
100                        params = new Parameters();
101                this.width = width;
102                this.height = height;
103                this.xRef = width / 2; // integer value
104                this.yRef = height / 2; // integer value
105                this.nAng = params.nAng;
106                this.nRad = params.nRad;
107                this.dAng = Math.PI / nAng;
108                this.dRad = 0.5 * Math.hypot(width, height) / nRad; // nRad radial steps over half the diagonal length
109                this.cRad = nRad;
110                this.accWidth = nAng;
111                this.accHeight = nRad + 1 + nRad;
112                this.accumulator = new float[accWidth][accHeight]; // cells are initialized to zero!
113                this.accumulatorExt = new float[2 * accWidth][accHeight];
114                this.accumulatorMax = new float[accWidth][accHeight];
115                this.cosTable = makeCosTable();
116                this.sinTable = makeSinTable();
117        }
118
119        // -------------- public methods ------------------------
120
121        /**
122         * Finds and returns the parameters of the strongest lines with a specified min.
123         * pixel count. All objects in the returned array are valid, but the array may
124         * be empty. Note: Could perhaps be implemented more efficiently with
125         * insert-sort.
126         * 
127         * @param amin the minimum accumulator value for each line.
128         * @param maxLines maximum number of (strongest) lines to extract.
129         * @return a possibly empty array of {@link HoughLine} objects.
130         */
131        public HoughLine[] getLines(int amin, int maxLines) {
132                makeAccumulatorExt();   // TODO: should not be here
133                findLocalMaxima();
134                // collect all lines corresponding to accumulator maxima
135                List<HoughLine> lines = new ArrayList<>();
136                for (int ri = 0; ri < accHeight; ri++) {
137                        for (int ai = 0; ai < accWidth; ai++) {
138                                int hcount = (int) accumulatorMax[ai][ri];
139                                if (hcount >= amin) {
140                                        double angle = angleFromIndex(ai);
141                                        double radius = radiusFromIndex(ri);
142                                        lines.add(new HoughLine(angle, radius, xRef, yRef, hcount));
143                                }
144                        }
145                }
146                // sort 'lines' by count (highest counts first)
147                Collections.sort(lines);
148                List<HoughLine> slines = lines.subList(0, Math.min(maxLines, lines.size()));
149                // convert the list to an array and return:
150                return slines.toArray(new HoughLine[0]);
151        }
152        
153        /**
154         * Returns the reference points x-coordinate.
155         * @return as described.
156         */
157        public double getXref() {
158                return xRef;
159        }
160        
161        /**
162         * Returns the reference points y-coordinate.
163         * @return as described.
164         */
165        public double getYref() {
166                return yRef;
167        }
168
169        /**
170         * Calculates the actual angle (in radians) for angle index {@code ai}
171         * 
172         * @param ai angle index [0,...,nAng-1]
173         * @return Angle [0,...,PI] for angle index ai
174         */
175        public double angleFromIndex(int ai) {
176                return ai * dAng;
177        }
178
179        /**
180         * Calculates the actual radius for radius index ri.
181         * 
182         * @param ri radius index [0,...,nRad-1].
183         * @return Radius [-maxRad,...,maxRad] with respect to reference point (xc, yc).
184         */
185        public double radiusFromIndex(int ri) {
186                return (ri - cRad) * dRad;
187        }
188
189        public double radiusToIndex(double rad) {
190                return cRad + rad / dRad;
191        }
192        
193        // ---------------------------------------------------------------
194
195        /**
196         * Returns the accumulator as a 2D float-array.
197         * @return the contents of the accumulator
198         */
199        public float[][] getAccumulator() {
200                return this.accumulator;
201        }
202
203        /**
204         * Returns the local maximum values of the accumulator as a 2D float-array
205         * (all non-maximum elements are set to zero).
206         * @return the local maximum values of the accumulator 
207         */
208        public float[][] getAccumulatorMax() {
209                return this.accumulatorMax;
210        }
211        
212        /**
213         * Returns the extended accumulator as a 2D float-array.
214         * @return the extended accumulator
215         */
216        public float[][] getAccumulatorExtended() {
217                return this.accumulatorExt;
218        }
219        
220
221        /**
222         * Creates and returns an image of the 2D accumulator array.
223         * @return a {@link FloatProcessor} image of the accumulator
224         */
225        public FloatProcessor getAccumulatorImage() {
226                return new FloatProcessor(accumulator);
227        }
228        
229
230        /**
231         * Creates and returns an image of the extended 2D accumulator array, produced
232         * by adding a vertically mirrored copy of the accumulator to its right end. 
233         * @return a {@link FloatProcessor} image of the extended accumulator
234         */
235        public FloatProcessor getAccumulatorImageExtended() {
236                FloatProcessor fp = new FloatProcessor(accumulatorExt);
237                return fp;
238        }
239
240        /**
241         * Creates and returns an image of the local maxima of the 2D accumulator array.
242         * @return a {@link FloatProcessor} image of the accumulator maxima
243         */
244        public FloatProcessor getAccumulatorMaxImage() {
245                return new FloatProcessor(accumulatorMax);
246        }
247
248        // -------------- nonpublic methods ------------------------
249
250        private double[] makeCosTable() {
251                double[] cosTab = new double[nAng];
252                for (int ai = 0; ai < nAng; ai++) {
253                        double angle = dAng * ai;
254                        cosTab[ai] = Math.cos(angle);
255                }
256                return cosTab;
257        }
258
259        private double[] makeSinTable() {
260                double[] sinTab = new double[nAng];
261                for (int ai = 0; ai < nAng; ai++) {
262                        double angle = dAng * ai;
263                        sinTab[ai] = Math.sin(angle);
264                }
265                return sinTab;
266        }
267
268        private void process(ByteProcessor ip, float[][] acc) {
269                for (int v = 0; v < height; v++) {
270                        for (int u = 0; u < width; u++) {
271                                if (ip.get(u, v) != 0) { // this is a foreground (edge) pixel - use ImageAccessor??
272                                        processPoint(u, v, acc);
273                                }
274                        }
275                }
276        }
277
278        private void process(Pnt2d[] points, float[][] acc) {
279                for (int i = 0; i < points.length; i++) {
280                        Pnt2d p = points[i];
281                        if (p != null) {
282                                processPoint(p.getX(), p.getY(), acc);
283                        }
284                }
285        }
286
287        private void processPoint(double u, double v, float[][] acc) {
288                final double x = u - xRef;
289                final double y = v - yRef;
290                for (int ai = 0; ai < accWidth; ai++) {
291//                      double theta = dAng * ai;
292//                      double r = x * Math.cos(theta) + y * Math.sin(theta);
293                        double r = x * cosTable[ai] + y * sinTable[ai]; // sin/cos tables improve speed!
294                        double ri = radiusToIndex(r);
295                        // accumulated quantity (1.0) is distributed to 2 neighboring bins:
296                        int r0 = (int) Math.floor(ri);  // lower radial bin index
297                        int r1 = r0 + 1;                                // upper radial bin index
298                        if (r0 >= 0 && r1 < accHeight) {
299                                double alpha = ri - r0;
300                                acc[ai][r0] += (1.0 - alpha);
301                                acc[ai][r1] += alpha;
302                        }
303                }
304        }
305        
306        /**
307         * Searches for local maxima in the extended accumulator but enters their
308         * positions in 'accumulatorMax'.
309         */
310        private void findLocalMaxima() {
311                for (int ai = 1; ai <= accWidth; ai++) {        // note the range!
312                        for (int ri = 1; ri < accHeight - 1; ri++) {
313                                float vC = accumulatorExt[ai][ri];      // center value
314                                boolean ismax = 
315                                        vC > accumulatorExt[ai + 1][ri]     && // 0
316                                        vC > accumulatorExt[ai + 1][ri - 1] && // 1
317                                        vC > accumulatorExt[ai]    [ri - 1] && // 2
318                                        vC > accumulatorExt[ai - 1][ri - 1] && // 3
319                                        vC > accumulatorExt[ai - 1][ri]     && // 4
320                                        vC > accumulatorExt[ai - 1][ri + 1] && // 5
321                                        vC > accumulatorExt[ai]    [ri + 1] && // 6
322                                        vC > accumulatorExt[ai + 1][ri + 1];   // 7
323                                if (ismax) {
324                                        if (ai < accWidth)
325                                                accumulatorMax[ai % accWidth][ri] = vC; // take care of ai == accWidth
326                                        else
327                                                accumulatorMax[ai % accWidth][accHeight - ri - 1] = vC;
328                                }
329                        }
330                }
331        }
332        
333        /**
334         * Creates the extended 2D accumulator array 
335         */
336        private void makeAccumulatorExt() {
337                for (int ai = 0; ai < accWidth; ai++) {
338                        for (int ri = 0; ri < accHeight; ri++) {
339                                // insert original accumulator into the left side
340                                accumulatorExt[ai][ri] = accumulator[ai][ri];
341                                // insert a vertically flipped copy of accumulator into the right side
342                                accumulatorExt[accWidth + ai][ri] = accumulator[ai][accHeight - ri - 1];
343                        }
344                }
345        }
346
347        @Override
348        public double getProgress() {
349                // TODO report progress state
350                return 1;
351        }
352        
353}
354
355
